data.title: Enrico Fermi – Nobel Lecture
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Physics 1938 was awarded to Enrico Fermi "for his demonstrations of the existence of new radioactive elements produced by neutron irradiation, and for his related discovery of nuclear reactions brought about by slow neutrons"
data.text:
Enrico Fermi

Nobel Lecture

Nobel Lecture, December 12, 1938

Artificial Radioactivity Produced by Neutron Bombardment

Read the Nobel Lecture

From Nobel Lectures, Physics 1922-1941, Elsevier Publishing Company, Amsterdam, 1965

Nobel Prizes and laureates

Eleven laureates were awarded a Nobel Prize in 2023, for achievements that have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind. Their work and discoveries range from effective mRNA vaccines and attosecond physics to fighting against the oppression of women.

See them all presented here.
